alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:17PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Navajo County near Snowflake, Arizona through 500 PM MST... At 416 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Taylor, or 23 miles north of Show Low, moving northwest at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylor, Snowflake and Dry Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 277 between mile markers 323 and 336. State Route 377 between mile markers 8 and 23. State Route 77 between mile markers 355 and 382. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
